sentences.sContent: We were each handed a badge with our name on it.
sentences.sCn: 我们每个人都拿到一个徽章，上面有我们的名字。

sentences.sContent: He now sees his wartime injuries as a badge of honor.
sentences.sCn: 现在，他把自己在战争中受的伤看成是一种光荣标记。

sentences.sContent: ...we still use culture as a badge of identity...
...sleep is so undervalued that getting by on fewer hours has become a badge of honor...

trans.tranOther: a small piece of metal or plastic, with a design or words on it, that a person wears to show that they belong to an organization, support sth, have achieved sth, have a particular rank, etc.
